com.lightbend.lagom.javadsl.api.deser

Interface ExceptionSerializer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JacksonExceptionSerializer

    public interface ExceptionSerializer
    Handles the serialization and deserialization of exceptions.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static ExceptionSerializer DEFAULT
      The default serializer factory.
      static ExceptionSerializer JACKSON
      The default Jackson exception serializer.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Throwable deserialize(RawExceptionMessage message)
      Deserialize an exception message into an exception.
      RawExceptionMessage serialize(Throwable exception, java.util.Collection<MessageProtocol> accept)
      Serialize the given exception to an exception message.

    • Field Detail

      • JACKSON

        static final ExceptionSerializer JACKSON
        The default Jackson exception serializer. This is only a placeholder, the framework will provide the actual implementation at runtime.

      • DEFAULT

        static final ExceptionSerializer DEFAULT
        The default serializer factory.

    • Method Detail

      • serialize

        RawExceptionMessage serialize(Throwable exception,
                              java.util.Collection<MessageProtocol> accept)
        Serialize the given exception to an exception message. The raw exception message consists of an error code, a message protocol, and a message entity to send across the wire. The exception serializer may attempt to match one of the protocols passed into the accept parameter.
        Parameters:
        exception - The exception to serialize.
        accept - The accepted protocols.
        Returns:
        The raw exception message.

      • deserialize

        Throwable deserialize(RawExceptionMessage message)
        Deserialize an exception message into an exception. The exception serializer should make a best effort attempt at deserializing the message, but should not expect the message to be in any particular format. If it cannot deserialize the message, it should return a generic exception, it should not itself throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to deserialize.
        Returns:
        The deserialized exception.
